items.title: Sonoma County amends Health Order following changes to state framework for reopening
items.summary: Sonoma County’s Health Officer, Dr. Sundari Mase, today issued an amended health order to align the existing local health order with the state's revised framework for reopening. The amendment to the Stay Well Sonoma County Health Order (C19-15), which was originally adopted in June, allows local businesses and activities to reopen as soon as possible under the state's new framework.

items.title: El Condado de Sonoma hace una enmienda a la Orden de Salud, como consecuencia de los cambios del marco estatal para la reapertura
items.summary: La Oficial de Salud del Condado de Sonoma, Dra. Sundari Mase, emitió hoy una enmienda a la orden de salud para alinear dicha orden local con el marco revisado del Estado para la reapertura. La enmienda a la Orden de Salud Mantener Sano al Condado de Sonoma C19-15 (“Stay Well Sonoma County Health Order”), la cual se adoptó originalmente en junio, permite la reapertura de los comercios y actividades locales tan pronto como sea posible bajo el nuevo marco de trabajo planificado por el Estado.

items.title: Job Opportunities as of September 23, 2020
items.summary: View a list of our current and upcoming job opportunities, including: Applications Development Manager  Healthcare Information Privacy and Security Analyst  Legal Processor I

items.title: Oficial de Salud del Condado de Sonoma presentará sesiones informativas en línea para la comunidad, los miércoles a las 3:30 p.m.
items.summary: La Oficial de Salud del Condado de Sonoma, Dra. Sundari Mase, realizará  una sesión informativa en línea para la comunidad acerca de COVID-19 en  el Condado de Sonoma los miércoles a las 3:30 p.m.

items.title: County Health Officer  to hold Online Community Briefings
items.summary: Sonoma County Health Officer, Dr. Sundari Mase, will provide an online community briefing regarding COVID-19 in Sonoma County on Wednesdays at 3:30 p.m.

items.title: El Condado de Sonoma reorganiza las cifras de COVID-19 para que concuerden con los datos estatales
items.summary: Según la información publicada por el Estado, el Departamento de Servicios de Salud del Condado de Sonoma cambiará hoy la metodología usada para tabular el número de pruebas de COVID-19 realizadas, y también el índice de positividad de las pruebas del Condado.

items.title: Sonoma County to reconfigure COVID-19 numbers to align with State data
items.summary: Based on information released from the State, the Sonoma County Department of Health Services today will be changing the methodology it uses to tabulate the number of COVID-19 tests conducted as well as the County’s testing positivity rate.

items.title: Sonoma County Board of Supervisors approves fiscal year 2020-21 budget
items.summary: The Sonoma County Board of Supervisors voted unanimously today to adopt a $1.9 billion budget for 2020-21 that avoids layoffs while making investments in critical areas such as fire recovery, permanent supportive housing, COVID-19 response and mental health and homeless services.

items.title: Guidance for Communal Dining Relative to the 2019-Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
items.summary: Sheltering in place is important for people in high-risk groups, especially older adults living in residential facilities.

items.title: Watershed Emergency Response Team to address Walbridge, Meyers fire damage
items.summary: The County of Sonoma has begun working with members of the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection Watershed Emergency Response Team to address public safety and health concerns caused by the Walbridge and Meyers fires in Sonoma County.

items.title: Notice of Funding Availability Now Available for CARES Act Emergency Rental Assistance
items.summary: The Sonoma County Community Development Commission (Commission) invites proposals for administration of a short-term emergency rental assistance program. $2,360,000 is available from the Federal Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act. The program will be designed to serve low-income tenants impacted by COVID-19 and low-income landlords who are negatively impacted by the eviction defense ordinance currently in place.

items.title: Notice to Intent to Award Contract
items.summary: The evaluation panel carefully reviewed and analyzed the proposals received in response to the above referenced solicitation.

items.title: Barber shops, hair salons and malls allowed to reopen in Sonoma County
items.summary: Barber shops, hair salons and malls in Sonoma County will be allowed to resume indoor operations with modifications on Monday due to revised health orders issued by Gov. Gavin Newsom on Friday and confirmed by Sonoma County Public Health Officer Dr. Sundari Mase.
